intro: Polystachya pachyrhiza, commonly known as the thick-stemmed sword fern, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polystachyaceae and is characterized by its robust, rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features long, pinnately compound leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Its inflorescence consists of dense, branched clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. Polystachya pachyrhiza is adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
